docs.text: a miracle of filmmaking , " some like it hot " is a brilliant film , and maybe the foremost example of slapstick comedy brought to screen with clever sight gags and plot twists .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is the pinnacle of writer-director billy wilder's career , a stunning feat considering the vast catalogue of films he had helped make .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: jerry ( lemmon ) and joe ( curtis ) are two stage musicians who go from gig to gig , trying to earn enough money to feed themselves .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: one night , as they're playing at a banned prohibition speakeasy , the place is raided .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as it turns out , the owner , spats columbo ( george raft ) was ratted out by toothpick charlie ( george e . stone ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: several weeks later , on valentine's day , jerry and joe go to a garage to pick up a car and end up witnessing a gangland murder of charlie by columbo in a parking garage .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: eager to escape , the duo are forced to take a job in florida with all expenses paid .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the only catch . . its a girls band .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: so josephine ( curtis ) and daphne ( lemmon ) , make their way onto the train and go to florida .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: on the way there , they meet sugar kane ( monroe ) , a bombshell singer who is looking for love .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: jerry and joe immediately fall for the singer , but there's two problems : 1 ) they're in drag , and 2 ) millionaire osgood fielding ( joe e . brown ) falls madly in love with daphne .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: what follows in pure hysteria , still complicated further by the arrival of spats columbo to florida for the " italian opera lovers festival " .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: tony curtis is hysterical as joe/josephine , especially in his preposterous attempts to woo sugar .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: marilyn monroe , in a wonderfully comic performance , is sugar , providing incredible timing and sex appeal , along with true sincerity .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the scenes , however , are all stolen by either brown or lemmon .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: lemmon is hysterical as daphne .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: cast as the less rational one , lemmon's performance is ridiculously crazy , it is disorder in the style all billy wilder's .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: brown is particularly hilarious as osgood , as we are treated to the finest kind of comedic irony .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he manages to use lemmon's ingenious performance as a springboard for an even loonier performance as a completely eccentric millionaire .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: every set-piece is flawless , as wilder brilliantly changes settings constantly , and uses every comic trick in the book to make his picture .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: wilder's script is stunning , as he carefully combines gangsters , cross-dressing , romance , sex , music , gender roles , and social taboos in a riotous blend of wit and oddball craziness .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: wilder manages to create scenes of utter hysteria , so pitch-perfect that the audience is dying of laughter with the last comic piece , the final line of this absolutely incredible film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: wilder's is dead wrong when he says nobody's perfect : billy wilder is , especially when he makes something this disastrously funny .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: nobody's perfect but billy wilder .
docs.label: positive
